item.title: Kat add a quote by Sonya Hartnett
item.description: "I am dying: it's a beautiful word. Like the long slow sigh of the cello: dying. But the sound of it is the only beautiful thing about it." -- Sonya Hartnett

item.title: Kat add a quote by M. T. Anderson
item.description: "We Americans are interested only in the consumption of our products. We have no interest in how they are produced, or what happens to them once we discard them, once we throw them away." -- M. T. Anderson

item.title: Kat add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "Each suburban wife struggles with it alone. As she made the beds, shopped for groceries, matched slipcover material, ate peanut butter sandwiches with her children, chauffeured Cub Scouts and Brownies, lay beside her husband at night- she was afraid to ask even of herself the silent question-- 'Is this all?" -- Betty Friedan

item.title: Kat add a quote by John Wooden
item.description: "You canâ€™t live a perfect day until you do something for someone who will never be able to repay you." -- John Wooden

item.title: Kat add a quote by John Wooden
item.description: "Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are." -- John Wooden

item.title: Kat add a quote by John Wooden
item.description: "Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do." -- John Wooden

item.title: Kat add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kat add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "A waiting person is a patient person. The word patience means the willingness to stay where we are and live the situation out to the full in the belief that something hidden there will manifest itself to us." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Kat add a quote by Richard Curtis
item.description: "Prime Minister: Whenever I get gloomy with the state of the world, I think about the arrivals gate at Heathrow Airport. General opinion's starting to make out that we live in a world of hatred and greed, but I don't see that. It seems to me that love is everywhere. Often it's not particularly dignified or newsworthy, but it's always there - fathers and sons, mothers and daughters, husbands and wives, boyfriends, girlfriends, old friends. When the planes hit the Twin Towers, as far as I know none of the phone calls from the people on board were messages of hate or revenge - they were all messages of love. If you look for it, I've got a sneaking suspision love actually is all around. " -- Richard Curtis

item.title: Kat add a quote by Lisa Schroeder
item.description: "Guilt reminds me of a stray cat. You chase it away and yet, it comes back when you least expect it. If you let yourself feel pity for it and feed the thing, it parks its ugly, puny, lonely-for-attention butt on your doormat and won't go away. Scat kitty cat, scat. I don't need you sitting around here like that." -- Lisa Schroeder
